summary: Building LifeOS as a web-based personal digital well-being/productivity dashboard (React/TypeScript frontend + Motoko backend) inspired by the Android OS-layer concept, due to platform constraints.
architectural_notes: Platform constraint: implementation will be a web app (React/TypeScript) with Motoko backend; cannot build native Android OS-layer tracking or system-level app blocking.
Phone-level usage tracking and controls must be implemented via web-accessible signals and app-internal features rather than Android system APIs.
known_issues: User requested a fully real Android OS-layer app; current platform cannot access Android system data, so true real-time foreground/background app tracking and OS-level controls are not feasible here.
Onboarding flow bug: after Internet Identity login, the 'Enter your name' screen's Continue/Exit buttons appear clickable (color change) but do not proceed/dismiss, leaving user stuck.

existing_features.title: Implement Internet Identity login and per-user data separation so each signed-in user has their own LifeOS dataset (events, analytics summaries, preferences, and reports). All user-facing text must be in English.

Create a web-based usage tracking system that records in-app and browser-available activity signals (since OS-level Android tracking is not possible): page/route visits, session start/stop, time spent, interaction events (e.g., button clicks), and optional user-entered context tags (e.g., Study/Work/Entertainment). Persist events locally and sync to the backend.

Build the Unified Life Dashboard UI showing daily/weekly analytics derived from collected events: time spent by category/context, frequency counts, sessions per day, trend charts, and a computed Focus Score / Productivity Index with an explanation of the formula used.

Implement an on-platform 'Behavior Engine' that derives routine/habit insights from events: cluster usage patterns by time-of-day and context, detect recurring focus windows, and predict a likely next action/context based on recent history. Provide these insights in the UI as 'AI-like' reports (rule/statistics-based, no external AI services).

Add a Smart Recommendations and Alerts feature that suggests focus windows, flags overuse patterns (user-configurable thresholds), and provides personalized digital wellness insights based on recent behavior.

Implement 'Focus Mode' and in-app optimization controls appropriate for a web app: a focus timer, optional blocklist for LifeOS sections during focus, and an in-app notification/preferences filtering screen (affects only LifeOS UI notifications, not device notifications).

Add privacy, security, and efficiency measures suitable for the web context: minimize collected data, provide a clear local-first + sync model, and implement optional client-side encryption for locally stored event data before persistence (using Web Crypto).

Define and apply a coherent visual theme for LifeOS (colors, typography, spacing, component styling) with a distinct 'calm productivity' aesthetic (avoid blue/purple). Use Tailwind + existing UI components consistently across all pages.
Generate and include required static images for branding and onboarding, and render them from frontend static assets (not via backend).

Fix the profile onboarding flow so that after Internet Identity login, the “Welcome to LifeOS / Please enter your name” dialog can be successfully completed and the user is not stuck on the name entry screen.
Add an explicit “Exit” action on the profile setup dialog that reliably lets the user leave the onboarding screen (log out and return to the sign-in screen).

new_feature_requests.summary: LifeOS web app: unified personal life dashboard with daily/weekly usage analytics, focus score/productivity index, and AI-generated behavior reports
App usage tracking data model + ingestion (web-collectable events) to support sessions, time spent, frequency, and context fields
AI behavior engine for habit/routine learning, clustering usage patterns, and predicting next actions / optimal focus times (conceptual within web constraints)
Smart recommendations: focus windows, overuse alerts, personalized digital wellness insights
Auto-control features in web context: focus mode UI, notification/preferences filtering within the app (no OS-level blocking)
Data storage and sync: local persistence plus cloud sync support in the web implementation
Privacy/security: encrypted storage where applicable and on-device processing priority where feasible in web architecture
Efficiency requirements: optimize data collection/processing to avoid excessive resource usage (web performance/battery considerations)
Modular architecture to support future scalability and feature expansion
Ensure the backend exposes and persists per-user profile data required by the onboarding flow (get and save caller profile) so the frontend can determine whether onboarding is complete.
